result.execSummary:
All charges against Christopher O Bergh in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher O Bergh is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher O Bergh

records.addlTxt: 3:27 P.M.  Defendant Christopher O Bergh in court.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi in court for Christopher O Bergh.  Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin. Complaints reviewed.  Court reviews plea offer dated 6-2-22.  21CT85 deft. pleads NC.  22CM15 deft. pleads NC.  Plea and waiver questionnaire reviewed.  Plea made freely and voluntarily.  Admits to one prior OWI conviction.  Court finds deft. guilty and orders JOC entered into the record for 22CT85 and 22CM15.  22CM6 and 22CM45 are dismissed but read-in. Dismiss 21TR1006.  State makes recommendation.  Atty Jaconi makes statement.  Deft. makes statement.  Court orders 21CT85 fine and costs of $1,681 + $46.50 blood draw fee to be paid with $6000 bond.  Remainder of bond to be refunded to poster.  40 days jail to report forthwith with Good Time and Huber granted.  May stay on bracelet at jail discretion.  2 days credit.  Alcohol Assessment and follow through with all recommendations and appointments.  6 points assessed to dl.  Driver's License revoked for 14 months.  IID installed on any owned, operated or registered vehicle for 12 months.  22CM15 fine and costs of $463 to be paid with bond funds.  6 months Oconto County jail concurrent with 21CT85.  Good Time and Huber granted.  May stay on bracelet at jail discretion.

Atty Jaconi and Atty Pautzke in Judge's chambers to reschedule P&S that was set on 8/29/2022 at 3:30pm to 9/12/2022 at 3:30pm.
Per Judge this will not be rescheduled again, no exceptions.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Phone call from Kim/Atty Jaconi and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the P&S that was set on 6/28/2022 at 2pm to 8/29/2022 at 3:30pm.  This was rescheduled at the request of Atty Jaconi, the case is not resolved yet.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:32 AM Defendant Christopher O Bergh in court.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi in court for Christopher O Bergh. NOT ON RECORD:  Reschedule P&S due to deft. needing more time to make arrangements.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Revoke $1000 bond from case #22CM6 and $1000 from #22CM45.  $5000 cash bond covers cases 22CM45, 22CM6, 22CM125 and 21CT85.    Wear GPS bracelet with alcohol sensor.  Absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.
1:04 PM Defendant Christopher Bergh in court with Sara Malcore who appears for Atty Jaconi.  Edward Burke appears for State of WI.  Reschedule P&S.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Phone call to Kimberly/Atty Jaconi and Jordan/DA's office rescheduled the P&S that was set on 3/28/2022 at 10am to 6/2/2022 at 2pm, this was rescheduled at the request of Atty Jaconi, he will be out on medical leave.

10:03 AM Defendant Christopher O Bergh in court with attorney Jevon Jones Jaconi.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Two new bail jumping cases have been filed 22CM6 & 22CM15, therefore P&S to be rescheduled to include all 3 cases.  NG plea entered for 22CM6 & 22CM15.   Bond not addressed by court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 000275,
Payable Number: 116570,
Receipt Number: 22R 000571,
Amount: $20.00
